page.title: 07PERTON MEMORIES
page.content: During the Second World War there was not much activity or troop movement around this area. What was once the Runway is now The Parkway. I remember that the runway was not lit up-this may be because of the blackout. Dutch, Polish and Czechoslovakian troops were based near the Airfield. In the autumn of 1941 the Princess Wilhelmia Brigade were based here and visited by Dutch royalty. Infact there is still a strong Dutch community in the area today. Before hte War the olf field was part of the local farmland and woodland that streched from Birmingham southwards to Kinver. I used to go cycling along the winding country lanes that surround Perton.
